Start winnowing the long list you've compiled from the new plant introductions for 2000.

Plan for drought and heat. Look for vegetables that did well in test gardens in this year's record heat, like Outredgeous lettuce and Blushing Beauty peppers. Some All-America Selections winners -- the sunflower Soraya, the cosmos Cosmic Orange and the tithonia Fiesta del Sol -- got good marks last summer, but your garden may not accommodate all these orange-flowered winners.

At two feet tall rather than the usual six, Fiesta del Sol is suitable for containers and small gardens. Cosmic Orange blooms from early summer until frost, and bees love it. These two will be available in garden centers in spring, but Soraya will show up only in catalogs. And if you can't get enough orange, California poppy (Eschscholzia mexicana) is easy and reliable, and it thrives in drought.
